page.title: 18HIGHLANDMAN LOAN
page.content: This road which is linked to General Wade's military road in the North was used annually by {cattle}and {drovers}travelling South to the cattle markets held at Crieff, Falkirk and South of the border. The road exits across the ford at the{River Earn}to the South of{Crieff. Drovers would travel from as far North as the Highlands and Islands. When on the mainland they would follow a course of drove roads South to the markets. It was much easier to use drove roads than the hard, metalled roads made by{Maccadam}or{Telford.}The grassy drove roads on which cattle could graze required{no payment, unlike the other roads where tolls were levied . {Highlandman Loan}is now a proper road and is used daily by motorists.
